oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photograph of Spencer Samuel Ferguson in training camp
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Photograph of Pvt. Ferguson in camp baseball uniform with his glove in his left hand. The "Mets" written on his shirt is a latter day defacement by his daughter Sheryl. He is posed in front of camp barracks, possibly Camp Hancock near Augusta, Ga. Ferguson served in the Ordnance Department in the World War, 1914-1918 and reenlisted at the end of the war. He was from Hickman County, Tennessee.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Ferguson, Spencer Samuel
World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
